skill.summary: Knowledge comic creator supporting multiple styles (Logicomix/Ligne Claire, Ohmsha manga guide). Cre...
skill.author: JimLiu

security_audit.summary: Static scanner detected 168 patterns including external_commands, weak cryptographic algorithms, and C2 keywords. All findings are FALSE POSITIVES. The scanner misinterpreted markdown code block backticks as shell commands, color hex codes as cryptographic hashes, and color names as C2 indicators. The actual code is a benign PDF generation script with standard file operations and no network access.

medium_findings.title: Markdown code block delimiters flagged as shell execution
medium_findings.description: Markdown code block delimiters flagged as shell execution
medium_findings.reasoning: Documentation formatting, not actual shell commands

medium_findings.title: Synchronous file operations in merge-to-pdf.ts
medium_findings.reasoning: Standard benign Node.js file APIs for local PDF generation

low_findings.title: Words like 'network', 'reconnaissance' in documentation
low_findings.reasoning: Content analysis vocabulary, not security reconnaissance

content.value_statement: Transform complex topics into engaging visual comics. Generate multi-page educational comics with character designs, storyboards, and panel layouts in various artistic styles.
actual_capabilities: Creates multi-page educational comics from text content
Supports multiple visual styles (Ligne Claire, manga, dramatic, tech, sepia)
Generates character designs and reference sheets
Produces storyboards with panel layouts and visual prompts
Merges generated pages into PDF documents
Auto-selects style and layout based on content type
limitations: Requires image generation skill for actual image creation
Output quality depends on source content quality

use_cases.title: Create tutorial comics
use_cases.description: Transform educational content into visual learning materials for students

use_cases.title: Make biography comics
use_cases.description: Turn historical figures or personal stories into illustrated narrative comics

use_cases.title: Generate explainer comics
use_cases.description: Convert complex technical topics into accessible visual explanations

prompt_templates.title: Basic comic
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a knowledge comic about [TOPIC] with 5-8 pages using the classic style and standard layout.

prompt_templates.title: Tutorial comic
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a tutorial comic about [TOPIC] using ohmsha style and webtoon layout for beginners.

prompt_templates.title: Biography comic
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a biography comic about [HISTORICAL FIGURE] using classic style and mixed layout, covering their life from [START] to [END].

prompt_templates.title: Technical comic
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an educational comic explaining [CONCEPT] using tech style and dense layout, aimed at [AUDIENCE].

output_examples.input: Create a comic about Alan Turing's life
output: Includes character designs, storyboard, and PDF output

output_examples.input: Make a tutorial comic about photosynthesis
output: Features Doraemon-style educational format with visual explanations
Professional illustration style with detailed business scenarios

best_practices: Provide rich source content with specific examples and vivid details for better visual storytelling
Choose style and layout that match your content type (biography, tutorial, technical)
Review and edit generated storyboards before image generation for best results
anti_patterns: Using overly technical jargon without context can result in confusing visual narratives
Skipping the storyboard review step may lead to misaligned panels and content
Ignoring aspect ratio recommendations can cause unexpected image compositions

faq.question: What styles are available?
faq.answer: Classic, dramatic, warm, tech, sepia, vibrant, ohmsha, realistic, or custom description.

faq.question: What layouts are supported?
faq.answer: Standard, cinematic, dense, splash, mixed, and webtoon layouts for different panel arrangements.

faq.question: Can I use my own characters?
faq.answer: Yes, provide character descriptions or reference images. Default ohmsha style uses Doraemon characters.

faq.question: How many pages can I create?
faq.answer: Short stories: 5-8 pages, medium: 9-15 pages, full biographies: 16-25 pages recommended.

faq.question: What languages are supported?
faq.answer: Auto-detected from source, output can be in Chinese, English, Japanese, or other languages.

faq.question: How do I modify pages after generation?
faq.answer: Edit the prompt file in prompts/ folder, regenerate the image, then run merge-to-pdf.ts again.
